summary: The Civilian Conservation Center Enhancement Act of 2025 aims to amend Public Law 91-378 to enhance activities related to Civilian Conservation Centers (CCCs). The bill focuses on workforce development, specifically in wildland firefighting and conservation. It authorizes specialized training programs at CCCs, prioritizes programs at certain facilities, and establishes pilot programs for workforce development, housing, and employment of covered graduates and students. The Secretaries of Agriculture and Interior are tasked with various responsibilities, including setting hiring goals and submitting a report on underutilized capacity at CCCs.
